TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlDsigXsltTransform extends System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform

Docs.summary: Represents the XSLT transform for a digital signature as defined by the W3C.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> class allows you to address an XML document using an XSLT transformation. This class uses XSLT to transform XML nodes into other XML nodes that you want to sign or encrypt.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform> class to sign or encrypt specific parts of an XML document using an XSLT transformation.
The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that describes the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform> class is defined by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigXsltTransformUrl> field.
For more information about the XSLT transform, see Section 6.6.5 of the XMLDSIG specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
## Examples This section contains two code examples. The first code example shows how to sign and verify an XML document using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform> class with an envelope signature. The second code example demonstrates how to use members of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform> class.
**Example #1**
[!code-cpp[Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.XmlDsigXsltTransform/CPP/sample.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.XmlDsigXsltTransform/CS/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.XmlDsigXsltTransform/VB/sample.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Returns an XML representation of the parameters of the object that are suitable to be included as subelements of an XMLDSIG element.
Docs.returns: A list of the XML nodes that represent the transform-specific content needed to describe the current object in an XMLDSIG element.

Docs.summary: Gets an array of types that are valid inputs to the method of the current object.
Docs.value: An array of valid input types for the current object; you can pass only objects of one of these types to the method of the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The valid input types to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform> are <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList>.

Public Overrides Sub LoadInnerXml (nodeList As XmlNodeList)

Docs.param: An object that encapsulates an XSLT style sheet to load into the current object. This style sheet is applied to the document loaded by the method.
Docs.summary: Parses the specified object as transform-specific content of a element and configures the internal state of the current object to match the element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to process subelements of a `<Transform>` element.
## Examples The following code example shows how to sign and verify an XML document using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform> class with an envelope signature.

Docs.param: The input to load into the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The type of the input object must be one of the types in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform.InputTypes%2A> property. The valid input types to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform> are <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to call the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXsltTransform.LoadInput%2A> method using the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument> object as the input.
